title: Strengthening e-Learning Practical Competencies: Digital-Analog Integrated Learning Design Tool Development Course

context.prior_knowledge: Comprehension of core concepts and intermediate-level application skills
context.additional_context: Competency enhancement program for professionals in education/teaching/learning fields

learning_goals: Using analog tools (e.g., sticky notes, whiteboards), learners complete a 40-minute language arts lesson design within 3 hours applying the "Brick" instructional design concept (Objectives, Activities, Assessments, Resources)

Using hybrid design tools with digital backup (e.g., Google Workspace for Education, Notion), learners submit improved lesson designs incorporating ≥3 peer feedbacks within one week, achieving "Excellent" ratings in ≥4 of 5 institutional rubric items

Following Design-Based Research (DBR) methodology, learners develop a usability evaluation checklist for one learning design tool, apply it ≥3 times in real educational settings, analyze ≥15 feedbacks, and propose improvements
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
